Kevin M. Jackson

So About That Pig

March 23, 2015

A few days ago I hit the self destruct button on this site. There wasn’t much there to begin with, but I had grown tired of the site and even wearier of the thought of planning out and desiging my personal site. It’s tough to start creating something when you have no real idea what the hell your designing for.

I was a bit shocked by the reaction that I received about pulling the plug and getting back to basics. I hadn’t really thought anything of it other than, “I’m tired”.

Some friends sent some really nice messages:

Honesty is a pretty great design aesthetic. Easily my fav portfolio site in a while: http://t.co/yZXoO8ydFA via @chuise

— Ariel (@aribraverman) March 20, 2015

This site says so much, so simply. -> “@chuise: Took some time last night to update http://t.co/3H0vwsRgob.”

— Mike Maney (@the_spinmd) March 20, 2015

The one that stuck out to me the most, however, was:

@chuise Funny how the new http://t.co/BEQuz8CbHX actually feels more personal. Maybe it's the words. I like it...

— Andreas Weiland (@Aweiland) March 21, 2015

… apply the first coat of lipstick to this pig.
